comment.text: This translation key is used to display the text "Select .PDF file" in a file selection dialog. It appears on a specific button when selecting a PDF file, and it's intended for users who need assistance understanding the purpose of the action.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Ընտրել .PDF ֆայլ' is a literal translation of 'Select .PDF file'. A more natural Armenian phrasing for user interface elements would be 'Choose .PDF file' or 'Select a .PDF file'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ընտրել .PDF ֆայլ (Choose .PDF file) or Արձակել .PDF ֆայլ (Select a .PDF file)

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation uses a polite request form ("...てください"). While not incorrect, it might be overly formal for a UI element like a file selection dialog. A more direct and concise phrasing could be preferable depending on the overall tone of the application.

The Lao translation 'ເລືອກ​ເອກະສານ .PDF' translates to 'Select document .PDF'. While understandable, a more accurate translation for 'Select .PDF file' would be something like 'ເລືອກ​ເອກະສານ .PDF ທີ່ຕ້ອງການ' (Select desired .PDF document) or 'ເລືອກ​ໄຟລ໌ .PDF' (Select .PDF file).
The period after 'Select' is missing in the Latvian translation.
The translation uses a period (.) before 'PDF', which is acceptable but could be improved for consistency with the English version, which uses a space.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Selecione o arquivo .PDF -> Selecione o arquivo .PDF

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Selectare fișier .PDF' is a literal translation but not the most natural way to say 'Select .PDF file' in Romanian. A more idiomatic translation would be something like 'Alegeți fișier .PDF' or 'Selectați fișier .PDF'.
The translation "PDF ගොනුව තෝදන්න" is not the most natural or precise way to say "Select .PDF file" in Sinhala. While understandable, it is quite literal.
The Slovak translation includes a space before the period in '.pdf'. It's more common to omit that space.
The translation includes a space before the period in '.PDF'. It's more standard to have no space.
The Serbian translation includes a period (.) after the file extension, which isn't standard in this context. It should match the English format.
